NetHome Plus Rate NetHome Plus 1.APP supports the latest software version of Android and IOS system. 

2.Due to special situations that may occur, the manufacturer explicitly claims: 

3.Not all of the Android and IOS systems are compatible with APP. The manufacturer will not bear any responsibility for any issue as a result of the incompatibility. 

WIRELESS NETWORK TYPE 

1.The WiFi kits are only supported by WPAPSK/WPA2PSK encryption and no encryption.WPAPSK/WPA2PSK encryption is recommended. 

CAUTION 

1.Please check the router website for more information. 

2.Smart phone cameras require a minimum of 5 million pixels to ensure the QR code is scanned appropriately. 

3.Due to different network configurations, request timeouts may occur thus it may be necessary to configure the network again. Please attempt to use the app or function inside the app again before reconfiguring the app. 

4.Due to different network configurations, the control process may occasionally timeout. If this situation occurs, please attempt to use the app or function inside the app again. If this is unsuccessful, reconfiguring the app may be necessary. If the timeout error continues, reinstall the APP and check your network connection. 

5.If this situation occurs, the display between the board and App may differ. 

NOTE: Manufacturer will not be liable for any issues or problems caused by the Internet, WiFi Router or smart devices. Please contact the original provider to get additional support. 

HOW TO USE THE APP 

Basic Functions 

IMPORTANT: Prior to using the app, verify that both your mobile device and ductless system are connected to the Internet. 

1.Log into the app. 

2.Select the desired ductless system to enter the main control interface. 

3.From the main control interface the user can control the ductless system\’s on/off status, operation mode, temperature, fan speed, etc. by touching the buttons at the bottom of the screen. 

NOTE: Not all functions are available for every ductless system. 

Cautions 

1.The WiFi kit complies with 47cfr subpart 15 and RSS 210 of the Industry and Science of Canada. Operation is subject to the following conditions: 

• This device must not cause a harmful interference. 
• This device must not accept any interference received, including interference that may cause undesired operation. 
• Only operate the device in accordance with the instructions provided. 

2.The WiFi kit complies with FCC and IC electromagnetic radiation limits set forth for an residential environment. To avoid the possibility of exceeding the FCC and/or IC radio electromagnetic radiation limits, human proximity to the antenna shall not be less than 8 inches (20cm) during normal operation. 

3.Changes or modifications not expressly approved by the manufacturer could void the user\’s authority to operate the equipment.

 Article1 General

 3.the account and password are important private data; close attention should be paid to protect them. the password should not be provided to anyone unless being enforced by law; it is recommended to avoid your personal information such as your name, birthday, and telephone number in the password. reasonable measures should be taken to prevent stolen of the password, no warranty is given for the stolen of password. 
 4. to the extent not prohibited by applicable law, in no event shall GD Midea be liable for personal injury, or any incidental, special, indirect or consequential damages whatsoever, including, without limitation, damages for loss of profits, corruption or loss of data, failure to transmit or receive any data, business interruption or any other commercial damages or losses, arising out of or related to your use or inability to use the GD Midea software and services or any third party software or applications in conjunction with the GD Midea software, however caused, regardless of the theory of liability (contract, tortor otherwise) and even if gdmidea has been advised of the possibility of such damages. some jurisdictions do not allow the exclusion or limitation of liability for personal injury, or of incidental or consequential damages, so this limitation may not apply to you. Press and hold the 'Display' button on the remote control for 3 seconds within 10 minutes of powering-on. When a single long or double 'beep' sound is heard and the Wi-Fi indicator light is flashing slowly, the device has entered quick-connect/network configuration mode. Press and hold the 'ON/OFF' and 'Purification' buttons on the device for 3 seconds or longer within 10 minutes of powering-on. When a single long 'beep' sound is heard and the Wi-Fi indicator light is flashing slowly, the device has entered network configuration mode. Aim the IR remote at the AC and press the 'Display' button 6 times within 10 minutes of powering-on. When 'AP' is shown on the AC's display panel, the AC has entered configuration mode. Press and hold the 'ON/OFF' button on the device for 3 seconds or longer within 10 minutes of powering-on. When a single long 'beep' sound is heard and the Wi-Fi indicator light is flashing quickly, the device has entered network configuration mode. Check if the Wi-Fi indicator light is flashing slowly within 10 minutes of powering-on to see if the device is in network configuration mode. If the light is always on, press and hold the 'Reset' button for 3 seconds and the light will change to flash slowly. This indicates that the device has entered configuration mode. Check if the Wi-Fi indicator light is flashing slowly within 10 minutes of powering-on to see if the device is in network configuration mode. If the light is always on, press and hold the 'Reset' button for 3 seconds and the light will change to flash slowly. This indicates that the device has entered configuration mode. Press and hold the 'Reset' button for 3 seconds within 10 minutes of powering-on. The indicator light will change to flash quickly, which indicates that the device has entered configuration mode. Press the 'Reset' button twice within 10 minutes of powering-on. The indicator light will change to flash quickly, which indicates that the device has entered configuration mode. Pressing the reset button for 2 seconds continuously until the Wi-Fi light turns to quickly flashing, it means that the device has already entered into AP configuration mode. With the device turned on, simultaneously press the 'Swing' and 'Mode' buttons for 5 seconds. When the Wi-Fi indicator light flashes quickly, the fan has entered configuration mode Press and hold the 'ON/OFF' and 'Fan Speed' buttons within 10 minutes of powering-on until a sound is heard from the buzzer. When the Wi-Fi indicator light flashes slowly, the device has entered quick-connect/network configuration mode Press and hold the 'ON/OFF' button for 3 seconds within 10 minutes of powering-on. When a long 'beep' sound is heard, the purifier has entered configuration mode Press and hold the 'ON/OFF' button for 3 seconds within 10 minutes of powering-on. When 'AP' is shown on the display panel, the humidifier has entered configuration mode Press and hold the 'ON/OFF' button for 3 seconds within 10 minutes of powering-on. When 'AP' is shown on the display panel, the dehumidifier has entered configuration mode Press and hold the 'Reset' button for 3 seconds within 10 minutes of powering-on. When the Wi-Fi indicator light flashes slowly, the air box has entered configuration mode Press and hold the 'Reset' button for 3 seconds within 10 minutes of powering-on. When the Wi-Fi indicator light flashes slowly, the smart socket has entered configuration mode Press and hold the 'ON/OFF' and 'Fan Speed' buttons for 3 seconds within 10 minutes of powering-on until a sound is heard from the buzzer. (If there isn't a 'Fan Speed' button, press and hold the 'ON/OFF' and 'Auto' buttons for 3 seconds instead.) When the Wi-Fi indicator light flashes slowly, the device has entered quick-connect/network configuration mode. Note: Turn the device off and on again if 10 minutes has lapsed since powering-on

Other features Security Monitoring Smart Control Gesture Recognition Invasion Protection Invasion Push Notifications Real-Time Monitoring Targeted Airflow Sidestep Airflow Empty Room Energy Saving Air Direction Gesture Control On/Off Gesture Control Recognizes gestures to turn the device on or off Recognizes whether the device is on or off Recognizes to direct airflow Empty Room Energy Saving is only available in cool or heat modes When Smart Control, Security Monitoring, and On/Off Gesture Control are all enabled simultaneously, turning on the device using Gesture Control will be unavailable (turning it off will still work).

More functions Self-Learn User Self-Learn Operation logs When the 'Self-Learn' function is enabled, the server will log all interaction between users and appliances to increase learning proficiency. When the 'Self-Learn' function is enabled, the server will analyze habitual interaction between users and appliances as well as automatically control the AC during setup. The temperature will be moderate after the AC has been operating for a while, which is more comfortable for the majority of users. The temperature will be higher after the AC has been operating for a while, which is more comfortable for users who like warmer environments.
